result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald J Calderon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 5 days only if revoked.
Concurrent with: 15CF146, 16CF196 and 17CF50

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 30 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 5 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no presence at any establishment that holds a Class B liquor license except for work purposes and at the discretion of the Probation Officer.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must undergo an anger manangement assessment at thr discretion of the P&P Officer.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ronald J Calderon in court with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 10:15 AM. Called 15CF146, 16CF196, 17CF50, 16CF220, 15CF173, and 16CF199. State - resolved - have complied with victim notification requirements in all cases involving victims with no response from any victims - on 15CF146 - defendant would plead g/nc to counts #2 and #5 as alleged and remaining counts DRI (#1 and #4); on 15CF173 - defendant would plead g/nc to #1 after amendng it to felony bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(b) and read new charge and penalties -remaining counts DRI (#2 and #3); on 16CF196 - defendant would plead g/nc to counts #1, #2 and #3 as alleged - remaining to be DRI (#4, #5 and #6); on 16CF199 - defendant would pelad g/nc to count #1 as alleged, remaining counts to be DRI (#2 and #3); on 16CF220 - DRI all counts (#1 thru #8); on 17CF50 - defendant would plead g/nc to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, remaining counts to be DRI (#3, #4, #5 and #6); parties are free to argue sentence and defense knows that the State will not be asking for a prison sentence. Gisselman and Calderon agree. Court checks and confiorms on all cases to make sure all PH's were either held or waived. Court amends count #1 on 15CF173 to felony bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(b) - reads new charge and penalties. Calderon pleads NC to all counts as stated by DA. Court dismisses and reads in all counts as stated by DA. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes argument prior to his sentencing recommendation - recommends on 15CF146 - 90 straight jail sentence on each count - concurrent to each other; on 15CF173 -  count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - concurrent or consecutive to jail time on 15CF146 - left up to court - 5 days credit (stipulated); on 16CF196 - #1 - court costs only with no probation, on counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - concurrent to each other - 5 days credit (stipualted); on 16CF199 - #1 - court costs only - 8 days credit that can be used someplace - no probation ordered; on 16CF220 - even though it was DRI - is entitled to 6 days credit someplace; on 17CF50 - #1 - straight jail sentence of 90 days, on count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with 90 days conditional jail time - concurrent to each other but consecutive to jail time on 15CF146 - 53 days credit; conditions of all probations to include: AODA and follow thru, anger management assessment, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars, class B establishments to include casino unless for work related purposes, employment/school, 150 hours of community service, costs on all counts. Gisselman makes argument prior to her sentencing recommendation - recommends a time served sentence and no probation - asks for time to report if jail time is ordered (no objections). Calderon makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF146 - #2 and #5 - 90 days in FC jail - concurrent to each other - huber and good time allowed - can serve the sentence in any County in the State of WI but it is up to the discretion of the Sheriff(s) - must report on or before  5/1/18 at 8:00 AM - credit for 6 days off on 16CF220 and credit for 8 days credit from 16CF199 for a total of 14 days credit - no DNA or surcharge on this case, court costs on each count - use bond posted on all cases; 15CF173 - #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - credit for 5 days only if revoked, costs, submit DNA sample and surcharge assessed - take bond posted, AODA and follow thru but at discretion of P&P officer, anger management assessment at discretion of P&P officer, maintain absolute sobriety, no present in any establishment that holds a Class B liquor license except for work purposes at the discretion of the probation officer, maintain/obtain full time employment/school (30 hrs/week - 5 jobs/week), 150 hours of community service on this case only; 16CF196 - #1 - court costs only with no DNA surcharge on this count and no surcharge on count #3; counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with same conditions, court costs only, credit for 5 days only if revoked; 16CF199 - count #1 - court costs only to include DNA surcharge; 17CF50 - count #1 - 60 days in FC jail - consecutive to jail time on 15CF146 - credit for 53 days - huber and good time allowed, court costs but no DNA surcharge; count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - concurrent to other cases - with conditions as stated previously - no additional credit, no jail time, costs including DNA surcharge; felony rights, right to appeal, use any bond available to pay all costs and refund any remainder to poster except for 16CF220 - refund that entire bond to poster, any unpaid fines due in 60 days/CO, must report to probation today, adjourned.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on March 29, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald J Calderon in court with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CF146, 15CF173, 16CF96, 16CF199, 17CF50 and 16CF220. Court has waiver of PH forms for 17CF50 and 16CF220. Calderon and Gisselman agree. Court goes thru waiver of PH form, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause on both cases, binds over for trial on both cases. State has filed Information on both cases that mirrors the complaints. Gisselman has Informations, waives reading of them, enters NG pleas to all counts. State has made offers on all cases, Gisselman has extended counter proposals and State has not had time to review them but informs the Courts that they are talking about resolving the matters. Court makes statement in regards to getting these mattes concluded, wants to set a JT date on the oldest case and have the other mattes track along as STC and if resolved, use the JT date to resolve all matters. State offers to have the two oldest cases set for JT and #1 and #2 - both just a one day JT. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on all matters, set all matters for FPT. Off record for scheduling. Back on record at 10:21 AM. Court will set 15CF173 and 15CF146 for 1 day JT on 3/29/18 and all other matters will track at STC.  Jury trial scheduled for March 29, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on August 31, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ronald J Calderon in court with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman.  Defendant Ronald J Calderon in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:12 PM. Called 17CF50, 16CF196, 16CF199, 16CF220, 15CF173, and 15CF146. Court - here on an AIA on 17CF50 and STC on all other matters. Gisselman and Calderon have that complaint (17CF50), waives reading of it, wishes to enter NG pleas. Court reminds that most of the charges on that case are felonies and he would prefer to get all the pleas on the same date and time. Court asks if anyone wishes to make bond argument on this case. Gisselman states that they wish to make a bond argument - asks for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to signature bond for stated reasons. Gisselman responds - again asks for signature bond on 17CF50. Court - bond - not willing to do a signature bond, asking how much the defendant can afford to post. Gisselman - $200 cash. Calderon makes statement. Court - bond - amends cash bond to $1000.00 cash on 17CF50 with same conditions. Court - set for PH, needs to know if time limits will be waived. Gisselman consults with the client, he is willing to waive the time limits for a PH. Court looking at 8/31/17 for a PH date and/or PLEAS on all matters. Gisselman would prefer to meet with the DA and see what can be worked out prior to setting it for 8/31/17 in case her client cannot post the $1000.00. Court is setting all matters for further proceedings on 8/31/17 at 10:00 AM (PH for 17CF50 and 16CF220) and all other matters are going to be set as FPT, continues bond on all other matters.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on May 18, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing on May 18, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Copy of the motion/order for withdrawal of attorney sent over to FOSO

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on May 18, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald J Calderon in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 10:39 AM. Judge Rhode appears telephonically from Langlade County. Called 16CF199, 15CF146, 16CF220, 16CF196, and 15CF173. Here for STC on 15CF173 and 15CF146, ARGN on 16CF196 and 16CF199 and an AIA on 16CF220. Court will do AIA on 16CF220 first. Streicher and Calderon have complaint, waives reading of it, will waive time limits for the PH. Calderon agrees. Court continues bond on that case. Court moves on to the ARGN on 16CF199 and 16CF196. Calderon and Streicher have the Informations, waives reading of them, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on both of those cases. Discussion on getting all matters scheduled, Court wants the older cases set for JT. State agrees but would also like a STC prior to the trial date. Streicher agrees. Off record for scheduling. Back on record at 10:52 AM - Court will set 15CF146 and 15CF173 for #2 and #3 respectively for JT on 5/18/17 and set all other cases for STC at 1:00 PM on same date of 5/18/17. State would prefer all other matters besides 16CF199 be set for PTC. Court responds. State would like a STC on 15CF146 prior to JT date of 5/18/17 and sets both of those cases for STC on 5/9/17 at 9:00 AM telephonic and Streicher to call Langlade Cty and then Langlade will call Forest Co. The remaining 3 cases will also be set for telephonic status conference on 5/9/17 at 9:00 AM, Calderon to appear in person in Forest County. Court sets 16CF220 for PH on 6/20/17 at 1:30 PM, Streicher to contact State one week prior to that date if the PH is going to be waived. Court continues bond on all matters. Adjourned at 10:55 AM.  Jury trial scheduled for May 18, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 30, 2017 at 10:30 am.
State's Petition for Forfeiture of Bond
State
Final pre-trial on December 15, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Ronald J Calderon in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Defendant Ronald J Calderon in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:16 PM. Called 15CF146 and 15CF173. State - filed Information on 15CF173 as defendant is waiving PH. Calderon and Streicher agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Streicher has Information that mirrors the complaint, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts on 15CF173. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on that matter and sets for FPT on 12/15/16 at 11:30 AM.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Ronald J Calderon in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:47 PM. State - here for PH on both matters - State does not have witnesses present today for stated reasons (matter has been rescheduled a few times) - asking Court to set both cases for another PH on 10/20/16 if the defendant is in agreement with that otherwise the State will dismiss the cases and will re-file both matters for both an INIT and PH. Streicher and his client agree to adjourn the PH. Court continues bond on both cases, sets both cases for PH. State appreciates the defendant not requesting a dismissal today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Ronald J Calderon in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:14 AM. Defendant instructed Court that he was intending to hire Mr. Kennedy. Kennedy does appear with the defendant but has not been retained, not being represented. Calderon states he is trying to get the retainer fee together. Recess to talk to SPD. Recalled at 11:47 AM, does qualify for SPD. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 12/2/15 at 10:15 AM.

No consumption of alcohol. No contact with S.P.

Defendant Ronald J Calderon in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:09 AM. Calderon has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Calderon understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, thought he had retained Mr. Kennedy. Kennedy was here previously and stated that they are working on it. Calderon would have money to retain an attorney if he gets let out. Court informs that he may qualify for SPD or court appointed attorney, sent paperwork for that. Court sets for AIA. Court continues bond at this point. Calderon requests signature bond. State - bond - $500 cash with same conditions. Court - bond - reduce to $500 cash with same conditions of no consumption of alcohol and no contact with S.P.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
